dialogue:
chatbot:: Hello, how are you doing today?
user:: I ' Ve been having trouble breathing lately.
chatbot:: Have you had any type of cold lately?
user:: No, I haven ' t had a cold. I just have a heavy feeling in my chest when I try to breathe.
chatbot:: Do you have any allergies that you know of?
user:: No, I don ' t have any allergies that I know of.
chatbot:: Does this happen all the time or mostly when you are active?
user:: It happens a lot when I work out.
chatbot:: I am going to send you to a pulmonary specialist who can run tests on you for asthma.
user:: Thank you for your help, doctor.

dialogue:

dialogue:
chatbot:: I need to stop eating such unhealthy foods.

chatbot:: What foods do you eat now?
user:: I tend to stick to fruits, vegetables, and chicken.
chatbot:: Those are the only things you eat?
user:: That's basically what I eat.
chatbot:: Why aren't you eating anything else?
user:: Well, fruits and vegetables are very healthy.
chatbot:: And the chicken?
user:: It's really healthy to eat when you bake it.
chatbot:: I guess that does sound a lot healthier.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Do you believe in UFOs?
user:: Of course, they are out there.
chatbot:: But I never saw them.
user:: Are you stupid? They are called UFOs, so not everybody can see them.
chatbot:: You mean that you can them.
user:: That's right. I can see them in my dreams.
chatbot:: They come to the earth?
user:: No. Their task is to send the aliens here from the outer space.
chatbot:: Aliens from the outer space? Do you talk to them? What do they look like?
user:: OK, OK, one by one, please! They look like robots, but they can speak. Their mission is to make friends with human beings.
chatbot:: That means that you talk to them? In which language?
user:: Of course in English, they learn English on Mars too.
chatbot:: Wow. Sounds fantastic!
summary: user: believes in UFOs and can see them in dreams. chatbot: asks user: about UFOs and aliens in user:'s dreams and finds user:'s dreams fantastic.

dialogue:

chatbot:: So go then.
user:: I really don't want to go by myself.
chatbot:: Well anyway, do you plan on going to school tomorrow?
user:: No, I think I'm going to go to the movies.

dialogue:

dialogue:

dialogue:
chatbot:: have you ever seen Bill Gate's home on the internet?
user:: no. what's it like?
chatbot:: it's got its own library, theatre, swimming pool, and a guest house. The house itself has about ten different rooms that are all hooked up to computers so you can get things done in each room through.
user:: would you want to live there?
chatbot:: I think his house is fantastic, but I wouldn't want to live there. You would have to hire one or two people to clean all the rooms in the house, plus a few people to take care of the gardens.
user:: what's your dream home like then?
chatbot:: my dream home is actually just a small cottage in a quite village in England.
user:: would you want to buy an old cottage or build a new one yourself?
chatbot:: old homes are great because they've got character. I think that's important.
user:: it that why you wear second-hand cloths as well? Because they've got character?
chatbot:: no, that's just because I don't have enough money to buy new cloths all the time!
user:: I see. If you lived in an old house, would it be decorated in a modern way?
chatbot:: no, I'd definitely try to restore it to its original state. I love to imagine what it'd be like to live in another time in history and living in a house decorated like it would have been 200 years a
summary: chatbot: and user: talk about Bill Gate's home. chatbot: thinks it's fantastic but wouldn't want to live there. user: asks about chatbot:'s dream house. chatbot: wants to live in a small and old cottage for its character.

dialogue:

dialogue:
chatbot:: There are advertisements everywhere here in hong kong. The city is so bright at night, with all the neon signs.
user:: I like it. It makes the city feel alive. I like all the different colors and I like the billboards with eye-catching pictures and slogans.
chatbot:: I think that there are too many of them. I think that companies spend far too much money on advertising. They should have lower prices instead. Then they would see more.
user:: I see your point, but if companies didn't spend money on advertising, no one would hear about their products. I agree that some form of advertising can be annoying. I don't like it when people try to give you leaflets with information about products you have no intention of buying.
chatbot:: I really hate receiving spam. I also dislike having to listen to advertisements and jingles when they are broadcast in stores or on the subway.
user:: Yes, that annoys me too. With billboards, you can look away, but with broadcasts, you can't avoid them. I like the way that advertising agencies use comedy in their campaign.
chatbot:: I like that too. I don't like the way that advertising campaign often tell you if you don't buy a certain product, you're not cool or modern or efficient or something.
user:: That kind of advertising seems to be very common with brand name products. They are always trying to maintain brand loyalty.
summary: chatbot: and user: talk about advertisements in Hong Kong. user: likes the billboards, while chatbot: thinks there're too many advertisements. They both hate leaflets and broadcasts but like the way that advertising agencies use comedy in their campaign.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Hi, Mr. Zhang. What's wrong? You don't look so happy. How was your date?
user:: I was turned down again. It's frustrating. I guess you'Ve got to teach me some skills.
chatbot:: Me? I'm even less experienced than you are.
user:: At least you know what American women generally like in a man.
chatbot:: Believe it or not, I guess American women like a man in good shape, which Chinese women may not care about so much. That's my honest opinion. I know you have been trying very hard.
user:: American men are naturally taller than Chinese men. So even if I exercise, there aren't many chances.
chatbot:: No, that's not true. I'Ve met two American women who were married to Chinese. But those Chinese look very strong and healthy. So if you exercise more often, I bet it will surely be easier for you to date American girls. How old is Jacky Chan? He's small and short. But I bet he can have any American woman he wants.
user:: You know, that's going to be a tremendous change for me. Because I never exercise.
chatbot:: Why don't you try then? Even if it doesn't help you find an American girl, you could still have a stronger and healthier body. You won't lose anything by doing that.
summary: Mr. Zhang was turned down again and asks chatbot: to teach some skills. chatbot: thinks American women like a man in good shape and suggests Mr. Zhang try to exercise.

dialogue:
chatbot:: What sports do you think women excel at most?
user:: I think women excel in every sport except the ones that are taboo for us to join in, like football.
chatbot:: I mean which ones are they better at than men?
user:: Why do you care? Women and men are different all around. I don't think they can be compared.
chatbot:: That's a good point. Let me change my question. What sports do women like best?
user:: Well, I know some women who love golf and I know others who love contact sports.
chatbot:: Are you saying that women can't be generally categorized?
user:: Are you suggesting that anyone can be?
summary: chatbot: asks user: what sports women excel at and is better than men. user: thinks men and women could not be compared.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Is there a city where it's always warm?
user:: Yes, there are many cities where it's almost always warm. San Diego, for example.
chatbot:: Are there any other cities where it's always hot?
user:: Many. Most of the cities in the southern part of the United States are hot all year.
chatbot:: But why do so many people live there?
user:: Most people grow accustomed to the climate, but there are many others who complain about it all the time.
chatbot:: Are there any cities where it rains a lot?
user:: Several. Two good examples are Seattle, in the state of Washington, and Portland, Oregon.
chatbot:: Tell us about some cold cities.
user:: In the north there are many cities which are very cold in the winter. Boston and Chicago are two of them.
chatbot:: Is it always cold in Chicago and Boston?
user:: Oh, no. On the contrary, there are many beautiful days, especially in the spring and fall.
summary: chatbot: wants to know the cities where it's always warm, hot, rains a lot, and cold respectively, and user: tells chatbot: these cities accordingly.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Julia, I would like to have a word with you. Have a seat.
user:: Thank you.
chatbot:: According to your performance, I decided to give you a salary increase. From next month, there will be a 2, 000 yuan raise to your salary. Although your first raise might not sound considerable, the company believes that with your ability, sooner or later you'll get a better raise.
user:: Thank you very much. Mr. George. As a newcomer, I understand that you have your consideration and I am satisfied with the raise.
chatbot:: I think you deserved this.
user:: Thank you again. I'll keep doing my best.

dialogue:

user:: Oh, no! I can't have failed. Are you sure?

user:: But I lost the chance.
chatbot:: Keep working hard, and then you will get another chance of promotion someday.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Hello, Sara are you finished packing yet? Do you need a hand?
user:: Thanks. Dad, but I can manage it myself.
chatbot:: Make sure you have your ID card. You will need it while you travel.
user:: Yes, I know. The problem is that I can't find it. Where did you put it?
chatbot:: All your important documents and certificates should be in the desk drawer.
user:: Oh, yes, here it is.
chatbot:: Sara?
user:: What's up?
chatbot:: Did you buy a map? Traveling can be really inconvenient without one, and you could even wind up lost
user:: No. Dad. We have a tour guide.
chatbot:: Also, take these pills in case you have any airsickness, and take some cold medicine, too. How about some band-aids?
user:: No, I won't get sick. I promise. Ok. I've finished. Bye, Dad. See you!
chatbot:: Take care, dear! Be careful! Oh Sara, wait a minute! You forget your raincoat and umbrella.
user:: Dad, that's all right. I don't think it will rain. And it doesn't make any sense to take that many things on a trip. Besides I like to travel light. Bye!

dialogue:

chatbot:: Well, maybe the net is slow now. Try it again.

dialogue:

user:: Warm water can be good for your stomach, which is empty at that moment. And freshness can keep the water active to clean your digest system.
chatbot:: Anything else?
user:: Yogurt, because it has protein, vitamins and it is acidic. If you drink it everyday, your stomach will be more comfortable.

dialogue:

dialogue:
chatbot:: How are you, Mrs. Brandon?
user:: Pretty good. How are you doing?
chatbot:: Not so good. I lost my job today.
user:: I'm sorry to hear that.
chatbot:: How are your students doing?
user:: They are very nervous about their final test.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Good afternoon, Dr. Anderson's office.
user:: Hello, my name is John Keat, and I was hoping I could come in today to see the doctor.
chatbot:: Are you a patient of Dr. Anderson?
user:: Well, no. I'm at a convention from Mexico and the manager of the hotel where I'm staying suggested that I call you.
chatbot:: Well, I see. What seems to be the problem?
user:: Well, I got this ringing in my ears. It's so terrible that I can hardly hear people talking now.
chatbot:: Are you in any pain or is there any fluid?
user:: No discharge, just a slight earache.
chatbot:: Does the pain happen all the time, or once in a while.
user:: It has been aching for two days and it's never stopped. I thought it might be due to my flying in the air, and after some rest it'll be all gone. But who knows it's getting worse. I need to see the doctor.
chatbot:: The doctor will be busy at the hospital until this evening. The earliest you could see him would be tomorrow morning at ten.
user:: The time is good for me. I'll come in then if that's okay.
chatbot:: That will be fine; in the meantime you should try to take it easy. Don't press your ear and don't have water in when you take a shower.
user:: Do I have to bring something when I'm seeing the doctor, since I have never seen a doctor in Canada.
chatbot:: For foreign visitors, I guess you may bring your passport for the hospital registration.
user:: Yes, I will. Thank you for your help.
chatbot:: Thanks for calling. See you.
summary: John Keat comes to Dr. Anderson's office and describes his earache to chatbot:. John Keat wants to see the doctor, but chatbot: says the doctor will be busy until this evening. chatbot: tells John to come tomorrow at ten with his passport.

dialogue:

user:: Good afternoon, madam. This is John Cruise. I wish to register a complaint about my video recorder.
chatbot:: I see. I hope I can be of some help. Can you explain what the problem is, please?
user:: Well, the recorder has severely damaged two quite valuable tapes of mine. And you guaranteed that this machine is the best there. I hope you understand that a simple repair is just not enough. I demand compensation for the lost tapes as well.
chatbot:: I'm sorry. That's all very unfortunate. I'm sure something can be done. I will put you through to our legal consulant, Mrs. Schroder. One moment, please. (dialing sound...) Hello, Mr. Cruise? Thank you for waiting. I'm awfully sorry, but Mrs. Schroder is having a meeting right now. Could she call you back later this afternoon?

dialogue:

dialogue:

dialogue:

user:: He's wearing his sweater. He's brown with white spots and... Sorry, 'm not thinking straight. You know, he's a big part of our family. We got him when he was a little puppy. I'm just worried he was stolen or is injured somewhere.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Hong, it seems like you really struggle to learn English, is this level too hard for you?
user:: I don't know. I think it's just boring. I don't like the workbooks because the lessons talk about baby things. I'm not a little child. I want to learn something more exciting.
chatbot:: Hmm, I have an idea that you'll like. This week, you can do a special project for class.
user:: Oh, what's that?
chatbot:: I want you to watch some YouTube videos of people speaking in different English accents. I'll send you the links for the ones you should watch, they're very funny. One person does about 30 different accents in 10 minutes.
user:: Wow, that's great, but, won't it be harder for me to learn English if I'm listening to so many different ways of speaking the language?
chatbot:: It shouldn't, this is just a fun project to help you get more interested in the lessons. There is a more serious side to it, though. I want you to write a one page essay about the videos and tell the class about your project on Friday. You can show some of the videos during your presentation too if you like. I think the whole class will benefit from this.
user:: I can't wait to get started. Thank you, Miss Winters.
summary: Hong thinks learning English is boring and wants something more exciting. So Miss Winters asks Hong to do a special project for the class to get more interested in the lessons.

dialogue:

dialogue:
chatbot:: Can you effect shipment during September?

user:: Well, considering our long standing good business relationship, we'll try hard to negotiate with our manufacturers for an earlier delivery.
chatbot:: Thanks. Then may I suggest that you put down in the contract'shipment on September 15 or earlier'?
user:: Let me see. Now the workers will have to work on three shifts for it. Well, we can manage it on 20th September. That's the best we can do.
chatbot:: Oh, that's very considerate of you. I'lI take your word for it.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Ben, what are you doing?

chatbot:: Why?
user:: Well, it's very comfortable just to drift here.
chatbot:: Have you thought about graduate school?
user:: No.

user:: You got me.
chatbot:: Now listen, Ben. Look, I think it's a very good thing that a young man, after he's done some very good work, should have a chance to relax and enjoy himself, and lie around, and drink beer and so on. But after a few weeks I believe that person should want to take some stock in himself and his situation and start to think about getting off his ass.

dialogue:

dialogue:
chatbot:: Well, no one could survive without water, but you see pollution has been making more and more water unable for drinking.
user:: Yeah. Water pollution has for a long time been a major concern among the environmental issues.
chatbot:: But what are the sources of water pollution?
user:: They could generally be divided into two categories
chatbot:: Well, direct ones are the pollution directly from factories, refineries waste treatment plants etc. , aren't they?
user:: Yeah. They are emitted directly into urban water supplies.
chatbot:: But what about the indirect ones?
user:: Indirect sources include contaminants that enter the water supply from soils or groundwater systems and from the atmosphere via rainwater.
chatbot:: I see. For the sake of us all, we should be an active participator in the prevention of it.
user:: Sure. It's an issue asking for everyone's participation.
summary: chatbot: and user: talk about water pollution and its direct and indirect sources. They agree they should be an active participator in the prevention of it.

dialogue:
chatbot:: We can offer you a 5 % discount.

chatbot:: Well, what do you suggest then? How about 8 %?
user:: When we say your prices are much too high, we don't mean the are higher only by 2 or 3 percent. If we are to place an order with you. I think a discount of about 15 % would be sufficient.

user:: There's no point in making a counter offer because the gap is too great.

dialogue:
chatbot:: You are seemingly upset. What's behind you?
user:: Arden wants to have a trademark for our new series of products registered. But I have no idea on the registering process.
chatbot:: That's not as complicated as you suppose.
user:: Is it so easy? I never experienced this. Can you tell me something about it?
chatbot:: It is known that there is a time limit for trademarks. And we should not have a similar trademark with the one in the same field.
user:: Based on what you said, does it mean that we can not have a trademark like 'genova', right?
chatbot:: Correct. And our country follows the priority of use principle.
user:: Can you tell something about the preparation for the register?

dialogue:
chatbot:: your mp3 looks so cool. Where did you get it?
user:: I bought it online.
chatbot:: really? Do you often shop online?
user:: yes. I buy most of my daily necessities online.
chatbot:: I've never tried E-shopping. Is it better than shopping at an actual store?
user:: yes, much better. You can log in a website, browse through many items and categories comfortably at home, order the goods, pay by credit or debit card, and the goods will be delivered to your home.
chatbot:: sounds good, and I don't have to queue up at the cashier.

user:: sure. You can buy almost anything you can think of.
chatbot:: perhaps I should have a try.

dialogue:

dialogue:

dialogue:
chatbot:: There have been too many unplanned shutdowns over the past few months. We'll have to make a few changes to the way we operate. We need to reduce our downtime.
user:: I agree, but the maintenance team is fully stretched dealing with problems. We don't have time to carry out any preventive maintenance.
chatbot:: We need to establish routine maintenance procedures. It costs us too much in lost production if we wait until something breaks down before we fix it.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Excuse me, I'm afraid you've parked in the wrong spot.
user:: Oh, really? Isn't this spot C408?
chatbot:: No, it's D408, my parking space. I have already paid for it.
user:: I'm sorry, I must have been confused. I had thought it's C section, but actually it's D section. I'll move my car right away.
chatbot:: It's no big deal. Thank you.
summary: chatbot: asks user:, who parked in chatbot:'s spot, to move the car away.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Why don't you watch where you're going?
user:: Me? You're the one who pulled out in front of me!
chatbot:: There was plenty of room for me to pull out. You didn't have to stay in the lane you were in.
user:: Hey, listen. I had every right to stay in the lane I was in. You were supposed to wait until I passed to pull out. And anyhow, you didn't give me any time to change lanes. All of a sudden--BANG--there you are right in front of me.
chatbot:: I think my arm is broken.
user:: Sorry about your arm, but it serves you right. You need to learn how to drive. You're lucky you didn't get killed. And I'm lucky to be alive too.
chatbot:: Listen, let's just wait until the police get here. Then we can decide whose fault this accident was.
user:: Fine with me. I know the laws of the road. I'm not worried.
chatbot:: I have a cell phone in my car. Now it's probably on the floor on the passenger side. Why don't you get it for me, and then I can call the police?
user:: Alright.
chatbot:: It doesn't work. It looks like it's broken. I need to get to a hospital. You should drive me there.
user:: Oh, yeah? It's better if we make a police report first. Then you can go to the hospital.
chatbot:: Damn it! I'm injured here. We could wait all day for the police.
user:: Well, you'll just have to wait. I'm not going to move my car until the police arrive. I'll go into one of those houses over there and use their phone. Don't worry. You'll get to the hospital in time.
chatbot:: It really hurts.
user:: Yes, maybe it does. But if you're going to drive like you did just now, you will have to get used to a little physical pain. You know what I mean?
chatbot:: To hell with you. The accident was your fault.
user:: I'm afraid it wasn't. And when the police get here, you will also see that it wasn't. But enough of this bickering. I'm going to go find a phone. Don't move that arm while I'm gone. Alright?
chatbot:: To hell with you.
summary: A car accident happens because chatbot: pulls out in front of user:'s car. chatbot:'s arm and the cell phone were broken, so user: needs to find a phone to call the police to decide whose fault this accident was.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Hi Kevin!
user:: Hi Laura, long time no see! What have you been up to lately?
chatbot:: Not much. I can assure you. And you?
user:: Much the same except I do have some big news.
chatbot:: Come on. This suspense is killing me.
user:: No, really, what have you been doing these past few weeks? The last time I saw you, you were looking for a new job.
chatbot:: Well, that's not exactly true. I was thinking about changing jobs. Luckily, they offered me a new position in the accounting department.
user:: A step up in the big business world.
chatbot:: I wouldn't exaggerate, but I am pleased. I had been hoping to get a promotion for a while. So when it finally came through, I was relieved. Actually, that's why I was looking for a new job. I just didn't want to work there anymore if they weren't going to recognize my efforts.
user:: Right, sometimes you can do your best and it seems like the others don't know you exist. I hope the money's better.
chatbot:: I got a reasonable raise, now enough about me. I'm dying to hear your news.
user:: I am getting married.
chatbot:: No, you said you'd never get married.
user:: That was then and this is now. You've got to meet Andrea, she's great!
chatbot:: This is all news to me. I didn't even know you were dating.
user:: We weren't. We've just been dating for two weeks now.
chatbot:: And you getting married?
user:: I know. I can't help it. I just know she's the one.
chatbot:: Well, congratulations! That's fantastic!
user:: Thanks, I'm glad to hear you feel way.
summary: Laura and Kevin meet each other after a long time and share their personal latest news. Laura got a job promotion and an increase in wage while Kevin got married to Andrea after dating for 2 weeks.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Where were you yesterday?
user:: I was at home asleep.
chatbot:: Asleep! I thought that you had to take an exam.
user:: I was sick. I had a fever. I couldn't get out of bed.
chatbot:: You still look a little sick. You couldn't go back to bed.
user:: I'm going now. I just came here to speak to my professor.
chatbot:: What did he tell you?
user:: He said that I'd be able to take a make-up.
chatbot:: Well, that's all right then. Are you going straight home?
user:: I have to stop at the drugstore on the way. I need some aspirin.
chatbot:: Do you think that you should walk that far?
user:: I have to walk. I didn't bring my car. 1 didn't think I'd be able to drive today.
chatbot:: Well, take care of yourself.
user:: OK. Thanks.
summary: Being sick, user: didn't take the exam but can do a make-up. user: finished a talk with the professor and is on the home.

dialogue:
chatbot:: What a great day! Hey, Tom, do you want to go to the beach this weekend?
user:: Yeah, that is a great idea. Maybe Sara would like to come along with us.
chatbot:: I doubt it.
user:: Why? You are kidding! You know, she loves watching the sea.
chatbot:: But yesterday afternoon she told me that she would go home this Saturday.
user:: What happened?
chatbot:: She said that her mother was ill and stayed in the hospital, and therefore she wanted to go home to see her.
user:: I am sorry to hear that. Well, What do you think? Should we take some food?
chatbot:: That sounds great. Maybe we could have a picnic on the beach. Then let's take some sandwiches, chips, and uh... some salad as well.
user:: We should also take some drinks like Coke and beer.
chatbot:: Good. In addition, we had better pack beach towels and sun cream.
user:: OK. Please don't forget to give me a call and let's go down together.
summary: chatbot: invites user: to the beach at the weekend as Sara, whose mom is ill, cannot go. They list some food, drink, and other belongings to take.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Yes, I'd like to report a theft.
user:: Okay. Can you tell me exactly what happened.
chatbot:: Well, I was walking home from work two days ago, enjoying the nature all around me ... the birds, the frogs, the flowing stream ... [Okay, Okay] when this woman knocked me right off my feet, grabbed my stuff, and ran off through the trees. [Hmm]. I was so surprised by the ordeal that I didn't go after her.
user:: Yeah. Can you describe the woman for me?
chatbot:: Yeah. He was about a hundred and ninety centimeters tall ...
user:: Wait. You said a woman robbed you.
chatbot:: Well, I'm not really sure. [Hmm]. You see, the person was wearing a white and black polka dot dress, a light red sweater over it, and she ... or he ... was wearing a pair of basketball shoes.
user:: Humm. What else can you tell me?
chatbot:: Okay. Like I said, the person was about 190 centimeters tall, heavy build, with long wavy hair. She ... or he ... was probably in his or her late 30's. I didn't get a good look at the person's face, but well ... uh ....
user:: What? Was there something else?
chatbot:: Well, the person ... had a beard.
user:: Ah! What was, uh, taken ... exactly?
chatbot:: Well, just my left shoe. Bizarre, isn't it?
user:: Ah. The 'bearded woman' has struck again!
chatbot:: The 'bearded woman'?
user:: Yeah. It's this man who dresses up like a woman and, for some unknown reason, removes the left shoe from his victims. He's really quite harmless, though, and he usually returns the shoe to the crime scene a couple of days later.
chatbot:: Hey, he can keep my shoe, and I'll just take off my left shoe every time I walk through the park.
summary: chatbot: reports a theft to a policeman. chatbot: describes the appearance of the thief and the policeman recognizes the bearded woman who often removes the victim's left shoe and returns after days.

dialogue:
chatbot:: I don't know what Jim's got to grumble about. My work load has doubled in the past year and I still manage. He is not doing anything different from when he arrived, as far as I can see.
user:: Yeah, but he's not as energetic as you are. Well, no one is. But the boss doesn't blame me when I get a bit behind. He is very understanding with me. But with Jim, he goes on and on.
chatbot:: I haven't noticed it. But you're probably right. I wonder why he does it.
summary: chatbot: doesn't understand why Jim grumbles. user: thinks he's not as energetic as chatbot: is and the boss is not understanding with him. chatbot: wonders why.

dialogue:
chatbot:: I'd like to find a job.
user:: We have several part-time jobs available here, Would you like to look through the list?
chatbot:: Yes, thank you. I'd like to apply for the job at the computer center.
user:: Please fill out the form.

dialogue:
chatbot:: What did the boss say to you? 
user:: He asked me to beef up in the work. 
chatbot:: Yeah. You look so unhappy recently. What's the matter. 
user:: Nothing, thanks. I am just not in the mood these days.
summary: The boss asks the unhappy user: to beef up in the job.

dialogue:
chatbot:: I'll always remember my college days. 
user:: Oh yeah? 
chatbot:: It was one of the best times in my life. It was tough, but I made it. I became a college graduate. 
user:: How did you feel when you graduated? 
chatbot:: It was a pround day for me. My family attend the graduation ceremony. I was so nervous. I couldn't find my cap and gown, but all worked out in the end. 
user:: What did you do after graduation? 
chatbot:: I was planning to attend gradate school, but then I was offered a good job doing marketing, so I changed my mind. 
user:: Sounds like you're happy with your decision. 
chatbot:: I sure am. So what about you? How did you feel when you graduated? 
user:: It was also a proud day for me, but I also felt like a kind of loss that day. 
chatbot:: How could it be? 
user:: While seeing others going to work or continue their study, I didn't know what I would do. 
chatbot:: You didn't have an offer? 
user:: I had one, but I didn't like the job very much. I wanted to attend graduate school, but I was afraid it would be too tough. 
chatbot:: I think you lack in the power of decision. Once you make your decision, don't be overtaken by misgivings and fear. Just go full steam ahead!
summary: chatbot: and user: share their feelings about the graduation day and different plans after graduation. chatbot: encourages user: to have more power on a decision.

dialogue:
chatbot:: hey Jayden, I was wondering if you could do me a favor. 
user:: that depends. What is it? 
chatbot:: it's kind of a big favor. I'm absolutely flat broke, and I owe my landlady $200. she's given me until Friday to give it to her, but I don't get paid until next Monday. Do you think you could loanm 
user:: I'd love to help you out, but I'm a bit short on cash this month as well. I had to get a new engine put into my car, and that ate up my savings. 
chatbot:: if you can't give me the full amount, a fraction of it would still help. I'll pay you back on Monday. I promise. 
user:: let's see, I've got about $50 to get me through the weekend. I can only spare about $20. I would give you more if I had it, I just don't have much money to my name right now. 
chatbot:: thanks a lot Jayden. Every little bit will help. Tell you what, if you aren't doing anything tonight, why don't you come over and have dinner at my place. 
user:: that'd be great. Thanks! What time should I come over? 
chatbot:: how about at 6 pm? 
user:: see you then!
summary: chatbot: owes the landlord $200 and wants to borrow some from Jayden who is tight on cash as well. Jayden only lends chatbot: $20 and chatbot: will come over at 6 pm.

dialogue:

chatbot:: I'm older than you! I'll be ten on April 14th.

chatbot:: Maybe. I'll have to ask my mother.

dialogue:

chatbot:: I'm with you on that. Check out that one over there. I think I'm in love!

user:: yeah! She could do anything she wants to me! 
chatbot:: I bet. Why not go over and talk to her? She's really nice.

chatbot:: good luck!

dialogue:

dialogue:
chatbot:: Good morning! 
user:: Good morning, Gav! Did you sleep well last night? 
chatbot:: I slept like a baby. I fell asleep right away last night, didn't wake up once, and didn't have any nightmares! 
user:: That's great news! You look much more relaxed than you did yesterday. 
chatbot:: I feel much better, but I'm still worried about something. 
user:: What's that? 
chatbot:: Well, I have to drive to school for a meeting this morning, and I'm going to end up getting stuck in rush-hour traffic. 
user:: That's annoying, but nothing to worry about. 
chatbot:: For me, traffic jams are quite stressful, because I'm pretty impatient. How can I prevent myself from getting stressed if I get stuck in a traffic jam? 
user:: Just breathe deeply when you feel yourself getting upset. 
chatbot:: Ok, I'll try that. 
user:: Is there anything else bothering you? 
chatbot:: Just one more thing. A school called me this morning to see if I could teach a few classes this weekend and I don't know what to do. 
user:: Do you have any other plans this weekend? 
chatbot:: I'm supposed to work on a paper that'd due on Monday. 
user:: Try not to take on more than you can handle. 
chatbot:: You're right. I probably should just work on my paper. Thanks!

dialogue:

dialogue:
chatbot:: Listen, Karen, I need your help. I don't know anyone here yet. 
user:: I'm glad to help you. What's wrong? 
chatbot:: My mother-in-law just went into the hospital in L. A. Hank and I will be flying there tonight. 
user:: I'm sorry to hear it. What's wrong with her? 
chatbot:: Doctors aren't sure yet. But the real problem is Suzy. She has a bad cold, and we don't want to take her with us. But we don't know who can stay with her. 
user:: You need a babysitter. 
chatbot:: Yes, I'd ask Jill, the girl I've had before, but I need someone overnight. Maybe even for two nights. 
user:: I could have Suzy stay at my place. 
chatbot:: I don't want to do that to you, Karen. 
user:: Why not? 
chatbot:: Your own kids would get Suzy's cold. I think it would be better to have a good babysitter here. But I don't know who to ask. I need someone more mature than Jill. It might even be for two or three days. 
user:: I know who we can ask. There is a girl I know, Sara Ralston. She is 17, and she will usually take this kind of job. I know her from my church, and I trust her completely. 
chatbot:: I'd like to talk with her. This is short notice, I know. But Hank and I are leaving tonight. 
user:: I'll get you her number. I hope she can do it. She is very responsible. 
chatbot:: I'm glad you know someone. I knew you would be the best person to ask about this. I don't want to insult Jill or her mother. I think Jill maybe could do it. But I'd rather have someone a little older. 
user:: I'll go home and get Sara's number. I'll call her first myself. 
chatbot:: Great. Then call me and let me know if she's free.
summary: chatbot: asks Karen for help to find a mature babysitter for two or three days because chatbot: will fly to L.A. to see chatbot:'s mother-in-law in the hospital and has to leave Suzy, who has a cold, at home. Karen recommends Sara who is mature and responsible, and she will contact her.

dialogue:

user:: Normally at least once a week. But she's now a volunteer teacher in a mountain village in Africa. I can only write her.

dialogue:

chatbot:: Well, my throat hurts. My nose has been running and I have a bad cough. It could just be cold, but I don't know for sure.
user:: You should take some cold medicine and get some rest. You don't look well.
chatbot:: I have a very important job and I can't miss any work. So, give me something strong.
user:: All right. But if you have the flu, only rest will help. If you're still sick in 3 days, you should go see a doctor.
chatbot:: Thanks for your help.

dialogue:

dialogue:
chatbot:: How was your summer trip?
user:: It was great. My friend and I travelled throughout India.
chatbot:: Sounds hot! How did you get along without studying the local language?
user:: Most People there speak English. But there were some remote places in the mountains where we had to learn a few words to communicate. Usually it was easy. One time, though, it got a little awkward. I was asking a baker for some bread and I said 'I want money' instead of 'I want bread'. The words for money and bread were so similar that I got them mixed up.
chatbot:: How did the baker react?
user:: He looked a little scared but my friend quickly cleared up the confusion. We ended up becoming friends with the guy and he introduced us to more young people. Whenever we told the story of our meeting, it would make everyone laugh.
summary: user: tells chatbot: about a funny experience about language confusion during the summer trip in India.

dialogue:

dialogue:

user:: Well, it depends on what you like. Running inside is nice, because you can stay at a steady speed. But outside is nice too, because you're surrounded by nature and fresh air.
chatbot:: Maybe I'll try running outside first and see how it feels.

dialogue:

dialogue:
chatbot:: Now we have settled the terms of payment. Is it possible to effect shipment during September?
user:: I don't think we can.
chatbot:: Then when is the earliest we can expect shipment?
user:: By the middle of October, I think.
chatbot:: That's too late. You see, November is the season for this commodity in our market, and our Customs formalities are rather complicated.
user:: I understand.
chatbot:: Besides, the flow through the marketing channels and the red tape involved take at least a couple of weeks. Thus, after shipment it will be four to five weeks altogether before the goods can reach our retailers. The goods must therefore be shipped before October ; otherwise we won't be in time for the selling season.
user:: But our factories are fully committed for the third quarter. In fact, many of our clients are placing orders for delivery in the fourth quarter.
chatbot:: Mr. Brown, you certainly realize that the time of delivery is a matter of great importance to us. If we place our goods on the market at a time when all other importers have already sold their goods at profitable prices, we shall lose out.
user:: I see your point. However, we have done more business this year than any of the previous years. I am very sorry to say that we cannot advance the time of delivery.
chatbot:: That's too bad, but I sincerely hope you will give our request your special consideration.
user:: You may take it from me that the last thing we want to do is to disappoint an old customer like you. But the fact remains that our manufacturers have a heavy backlog on their hands.
chatbot:: But can't you find some way to get round your producers for an earlier delivery? Make a special effort, please. A timely delivery means a lot to us.
user:: All right. We'll get in touch with our producers and see what they have to say.
summary: chatbot: thinks the earliest shipment user: can provide is too late and requests user: to advance the time of delivery. user: refuses due to several specific reasons, but finally user: is persuaded to contact the producers to see if they can help.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Good afternoon, how can I help you?
user:: Someone has stolen my gold necklace.
chatbot:: I am sorry to hear about that. Would you mind coming with me to my office and tell me exactly what happened here?
user:: Of course not.
chatbot:: Are you sure that it isn't somewhere in your room?
user:: Yes, I've looked everywhere in my room and I can't find it.
chatbot:: Ok, when and where did you last see it?
user:: Last night on the dresser. I took it off before I went to the shower, and forgot to put it back on after the shower. And this morning I left the hotel in a hurry without wearing it.
chatbot:: Are you sure you didn't wear it this morning?
user:: Yes, I am positive.
chatbot:: Did you remember to lock your door before you left then?
user:: Yes, I think I did. It has to be one of your maids who took it. I want my necklace back.
chatbot:: Well, I understand how you feel, and we will try to do our best to help you. But first please allow me to send one of the housemaids to your room to look for it again thoroughly, just in case it's still in there. If she finds it, we will all be happy. If she doesn't, we will turn the whole matter to the police. But I must say that the hotel can't be held responsible for your loss. You should have locked your gold necklace away at the hotel's safety box. If you had read your key card carefully, you would have realized that we specially warned you to do so.
user:: That just isn't good enough. Cet me your general manager. I want to speak to him now.
chatbot:: I am sorry, ma'am. Our general manager is not in town. But I'd be more than glad to get you our assistant manager, if you like. But I am afraid that he will say the same thing. We have very clear instructions about valuables and we must follow them. And now if you will excuse me, I'll go and find our assistant manager for you.
summary: user: claims that her necklace has been stolen. chatbot: asks user: about some details. chatbot: suggests sending one housemaid to look for it again thoroughly. If she doesn't find it, they will turn the case to the police, but the hotel will not be responsible for user:'s loss. user: is not satisfied with the answer and wants to speak to the general manager. chatbot: refuses.

dialogue:
chatbot:: What seems to be the problem?
user:: I have a really bad toothache! My cheek is swollen and I can't eat anything.
chatbot:: Let's have a look. Mmmm. This doesn't look too good. I think we may have to pull out your wisdom tooth. It's pressing against your molars and that's one of the reasons you are experiencing so much pain
user:: When you pull my tooth will you also have to extract the nerve and the root?
chatbot:: First we will take some x-rays and see what we're dealing with. I also noticed a small cavity up front here, so you are going to need a filling.
user:: I guess that's what I get for not flossing or brushing my teeth three times a day.
chatbot:: It could be that, or maybe you are eating too many sweets. In any case, I'll administer an anesthetic and you won't feel a thing!
summary: user: is having a bad toothache. chatbot: checks user:'s teeth and suggests pulling out the wisdom tooth.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Right, well, in the studio this morning, for our interview spot is Peter Wilson. Peter works for Green Peace. So, Peter, welcome.
user:: Thanks a lot. It's good to be here.
chatbot:: Great! Now, Peter, perhaps you can tell us something about Green Peace and your job there.
user:: Sure. Well, I'll start by telling you roughly what Green Peace is all about. I actually work in London for the Green Peace organization. We've been going for a few decades and we're a non-violent, non-political organization. We're involved in anti-nuclear activity, conservation and protection of animals and protection and support of our eco-system. I'm the action organizer and arrange any protests.
chatbot:: Right! A pretty important role, Peter. What sort of protest would you organize?
user:: Well, recently we've been involved in anti-nuclear campaigns. I've personally arranged for the demonstration against radioactive waste dumping in the Atlantic Ocean. We've got a few small Green Peace boats that we harass the dumping ship with.
chatbot:: Say? Hold on, Peter. I thought you said your organization was non-violent. What do you mean by 'harass'?
user:: Well, we circle round and round the ships and get in the way when they try to dump the drums of nuclear waste in the sea. We talk to the men and try to change, you know, yell at them to stop. We generally make ourselves as much of a nuisance as possible. 
chatbot:: Well, people may think differently of your methods, but there's no doubt you're doing a great job. Keep it up and good luck. And thanks for talking with us.
summary: chatbot: interviews Peter Wilson who is the action organizer of Green Peace organization. chatbot: asks Peter to introduce to the audience what Green Peace is and what work it does. Peter also introduces detailed anti-nuclear campaigns.

dialogue:

dialogue:

dialogue:
chatbot:: Excuse me. Do you think I can get there in time to catch the 11:30 train?

chatbot:: Are you sure that I can get there in time if we take the less heavy route? 
user:: Generally speaking, we can if we go at this speed and nothing unexpected happens. 
chatbot:: How much more do I have to pay?

chatbot:: That's acceptable. No one wants to miss a train. 
user:: OK. . . Here we are. We'll turn left at this cross. To go straight ahead is the shortest route. 
chatbot:: Thank you!

dialogue:
chatbot:: Nice to see you again, Mike. How was your trip to China?

chatbot:: Sounds great.

The game between Canada and Argentina ended in a tie, 3 to 3. And in a game that still in progress, Italy is leading Haiti 2 to 1, with 30 minutes left to go.

dialogue:

user:: No, not at all.
chatbot:: Thanks a lot. First, could you tell me about travel arrangements for your last holidays? Did you experience any difficulties in your journey?
user:: Well, our plane didn't take off on time. It was delayed 5 hours. So we didn't get to Lhasa until 4:00 in the morning, and we were very tired when we got there. But we managed to book a car at the airport through a car rental platform. And it dropped us off at the hotel in time around 7:00 o'clock for breakfast, so that was alright.
chatbot:: And how was the hotel?

dialogue:
chatbot:: Hi, Bill. Can you tell me how it happened?
user:: Sure. I was climbing the mountain in Nuremberg. Suddenly, the weather became really bad. There was lots of snow and we couldn't see anything. We got lossed. Well, we spent 4 days on the mountain. The temperature was 20 degrees below 0. We didn't have any equipment or food.
chatbot:: So what happened? I guess somebody found you, right?
user:: Yes. But we were very sick. I couldn't move my legs because of the cold. I spent 2 months in the hospital. The doctors removed my legs.
chatbot:: Right, so you lost your legs, but you want to try your best to stay active.
user:: That's right. In fact, I decided to make some new legs for myself. I realized that no one has to be physically disabled. We can use modern technology to help.
chatbot:: And you built the new legs. Can you go mountain climbing again?
user:: Yes, I can. In fact, these are better than climbing shoes. The spring design means they're much more powerful.
summary: Bill tells chatbot: his legs were removed because of a terrible accident in the mountain, but he built a new leg and now he can go mountain climbing again.

dialogue:

The longer the term, the higher the Dividend you earn. This is because it is calculated at the Compound Interest Rate.

chatbot:: Yes. And if you already have a Current Account with us, the Insurance Premium can be paid through it, which saves all of us a lot of hassle.

dialogue:

dialogue:
chatbot:: You have been here for how long? Four months now?
user:: Yeah, about.
chatbot:: Do you know Chinese better now?
user:: Oh, definitely. I remember, when I first arrived in Guangzhou, my girlfriend was haggling with a sales clerk over the price of a mobile phone.
chatbot:: Oh, yeah. Many Chinese like to bargain. It happens almost everywhere.
user:: I mean, I understand that. But the speed of the conversation got faster and faster, until it seemed to me that they would fight. My perception of the tone was that it was a violent shouting match. The truth was that it was a perfectly normal conversation.
chatbot:: A shouting match? You're so funny. You must be exaggerating. I don't believe it.
user:: I am not exaggerating at all. I'm telling you the truth. That was how I felt at that time.
chatbot:: Yes, perhaps. Chinese usually don't notice that sort of thing. Maybe it's quite natural to us.
user:: Yes, absolutely true.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Well, Mike, nowadays there's much talk about nanometer. But what on earth is it?
user:: Nanometer is a length scale. It's one billionth of a meter, roughly ten times the size of an individual atom.
chatbot:: Hmm. . . it's hard to figure out the exact size, I'm afraid.
user:: Well, let's make it this way. For comparison, 10 NM is 1000 times smaller than the diameter of a human hair. There are as many nanometers in an inch as there are inches in 400 miles.
chatbot:: I see. Thank you.
summary: Mike explains the concept of nanometer to chatbot:. chatbot: understands it.

dialogue:
chatbot:: So, Emily, how was your day?
user:: I don't think you really want to hear about it.
chatbot:: It can't have been that bad. Go on and tell me about it.
user:: To be honest, it was horrible! My manager is such a pain in the neck!
chatbot:: Why? What happened?
user:: Well, he made quite a few mistakes on the monthly report and when his supervisor found them, my manager blamed them on me!
chatbot:: That's not very fair. What did you do?
user:: There wasn't really anything that I could do. There's always been a lot of bad blood between my manager and myself. If I had said anything, he would have fired me for sure.
chatbot:: Does he treat everyone in your department like this?
user:: He treats everyone pretty badly, but the way he treats me really takes the cake!
chatbot:: Do you have any idea why he treats you worse than the others?
user:: I really have no idea. All I know is that the thought of him really curls my hair!
chatbot:: Is there anyone else you can talk to about it at your company?
user:: Not really. I'm hoping to live with it for a while until I get a promotion.
chatbot:: That's very sensible. It sounds like you have a good head on your shoulders.
user:: I try to be sensible about it, but it's not very easy. Sometimes you just have to grin and bear it.
chatbot:: That's so true. When you have a taste for success, you can't let dishonest people like your manager get in the way.
summary: Emily tells chatbot: that she had a bad day because her manager blamed his mistakes on her. Emily says her manager treats everyone, especially her, badly, but she hopes to live with it for a while until she gets a promotion. chatbot: thinks Emily is sensible.

dialogue:

user:: You are in the right place. Roll up your left sleeve and have a seat.
chatbot:: What am I being tested for?
user:: Your doctor wants to know what your white blood cell count is.
chatbot:: What does my white blood cell count tell him?
user:: Usually if your white count is off, the doctor suspects an infection.
chatbot:: How much will it hurt?
user:: It is only a pin prick. I have to put this tourniquet on your arm to make the vein easier to find.
chatbot:: Is that my blood going into that tube?
user:: That blood that just filled the tube is all that I needed. Thanks for coming in!
summary: user: is drawing chatbot:'s blood as the doctor wants to know chatbot:'s white blood cell count.

dialogue:
chatbot:: What made you decide on this type of occupation?
user:: Oh, to tell you the truth, I love the sky. When I was a child, I imagined flying into the blue sky some day. Now, I think the day has come. My dream will come true. And I like travelling very much and I enjoy working with people.
chatbot:: Can you make yourself understood in English without too much difficulty?
user:: Yes, I think I am quite fluent in English. I got the certificate of the Secondary English Training last month.
chatbot:: Do you know what the responsibilities are for a stewardess?
user:: The main responsibility of the stewardess is to make the passengers relaxed and happy during the flight. And good service is also important.
chatbot:: Are you in good health?
user:: I just had a complete physical examination and I am in top condition.
chatbot:: Have you had any nursing experience?
user:: Yes, I have two years of nursing experience, and now I am working as a nurse in a hospital.
chatbot:: How tall are you? What about your eyesight?
user:: My height is one meter and sixty-eight centimeters. I've never had any vision problems.
chatbot:: What would you say are your strengths and weaknesses?
user:: One of my strengths is my friendliness and open-minded attitude and also I think I have a warm personality. But sometimes, I find it is hard to tell others when I don't like what they are doing.
chatbot:: If a passenger can't understand what you say, what should you do?
user:: I'll try to speak in another language or I'll try my best to use gestures and draw pictures.
summary: chatbot: is interviewing user: who wants to get a job as a stewardess. chatbot: asks user: about user:'s motivation, English level, health condition, nursing experience, height, eyesight, strengths, weaknesses, etc.

dialogue:

user:: I've been a secretary for two years, before that I was at university.
chatbot:: And how do you like working for IBM?
user:: It's challenging, I feel I have learned a lot.

dialogue:
chatbot:: What kind of personality do you think you have?
user:: I am very active and energetic. I approach things enthusiastically and I don't like leaving them half done.
chatbot:: Do you think you are introverted or extroverted?
user:: I am quite outgoing, I think. I enjoy mixing and doing things with other people.
chatbot:: What do you think is the most important thing for you to be happy?
user:: I maintain that the most important thing is having good friends. A person can't live all by himself. A friend in need is a friend indeed. So the more really close friends I have, the happier I am.
chatbot:: Do you have any friend you would call really close ones?
user:: Yes, I would call three of my former classmates really close friends. We often get together and talk with each other. Whenever I counter difficulties, they are always ready to give me a hand.
chatbot:: What kind of people would you like to work with?
user:: People who are honest, dedicated to their work and have integrity.
chatbot:: What kind of people you find hard to work with?
user:: Slacker and those who violate working principles.
summary: user: thinks user: is active, energetic, and outgoing. user: values friendship very much and tells chatbot: about user:'s close friends. user: likes to work with people who are honest, dedicated, and have integrity and finds it hard to work with slackers and those who violate working principles.

dialogue:
chatbot:: How do you think a manager should react to an employee's unsatisfactory work?
user:: If I were a manager, I would have a private talk with this employee to figure out the reasons. It is very important to have this one-to-one discussion in an unthreatening situation without any distraction.
chatbot:: Exactly, I overheard a manager scold his employee in the elevator this morning, they were from the company on the 12th floor, I guess. They were only three of us in the elevator, I felt very embarrassed to be in the middle of them.
user:: Well, I guess the employee would feel more embarrassed and probably angry. Anyway, it is not wise at all to give a harsh time to your employee in front of others, especially strangers.
chatbot:: Sure, no matter what happened, they should wait to discuss in their office and find the solution in a positive way.
summary: chatbot: and user: agree that a manager should discuss an employee's unsatisfactory work one-to-one in a positive way.

dialogue:

dialogue:

user:: About a dozen so far.
chatbot:: What kind of newspapers buy them?

chatbot:: Is there any future in it?
user:: I hope so. There's a chance I may sell this article to a news service.
chatbot:: Then your story would be published in several papers, wouldn't it?

chatbot:: That would be great.

dialogue:

user:: I don't think I have any problem with our Chinese partners. They have always followed the contract strictly. We can do business directly with the corporation. As I mentioned before, the Chinese government is trying very hard to perfect its law. Its commercial legislation provides legal protection for foreign companies.
chatbot:: Well, it's known that the Sino-American relation is in a dilemma. Does it influence your business in China?
user:: Actually not at present. But we are afraid it will. You know policies influence business to some extent. I hope our government will not be influenced by some extremists. China is really a large market. We don't want to lose it.

summary: chatbot: interviews user: several questions about user:'s business with China. user: says user:'s business is protected by law and the Sino-American relation hasn't influenced the business from now.

dialogue:

user:: Yeah it's too bad. . . but actually I think I know what to do.
chatbot:: What's that?
user:: We can go to a horror movie, and I'll hold your hand so you don't get scared.
chatbot:: You mean. . . like on a second date?
user:: Of course! Or are you still too scared!
chatbot:: No way! That sounds great!
summary: user: suggests going to a horror movie next on the second date, and chatbot: agrees.

dialogue:
chatbot:: could we possibly discuss my salary some time?
user:: sure.
chatbot:: first of all, I want you to know that I really like working for this company. Do you think I'm doing a good job here?
user:: well, you are a very hard-worker.
chatbot:: I try very hard. The problem is, my salary just isn't enough to live on. Now that I have a wife and a child to support, we hardly have enough money for food and rent.
user:: there are trying times for everyone. What do you propose?
chatbot:: I could really use a 5 % rise.
user:: that's quite a bit. If I give you a raise, I'm going to have to give everyone a raise.
chatbot:: listen, if you give me a raise, I'll take on extra responsibilities.
user:: that sounds reasonable. How about this, from now on, you can be responsible for scheduling. That means that if you can't find someone to cover a shift, then you'll have to do it.
chatbot:: that's fine. Do I get over-time for any extra hours that I work?
user:: of course. It's be against the law if we didn't.
chatbot:: that sounds good to me. I really appreciate it.
user:: you are welcome. Come in early tomorrow and I'll show you how to do the scheduling.
summary: chatbot: asks user: for a salary raise and proposes a 5% rise. user: thinks if chatbot: takes on extra responsibilities for scheduling, the rise will be reasonable.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Did you enjoy that new movie?
user:: That movie's just a lot of noise, same as Simon.
chatbot:: Oh, what happened, Carole?
user:: I had to go by myself, he couldn't make it.
chatbot:: What? I met him just before I took off from Kitty's, he said he was coming.
user:: Kitty's? He sure gets around, doesn't he?
chatbot:: Looks like it. So how did he handle it to?
user:: His excuse was familiar. He said his car died again.
chatbot:: I think that's a bunch of nonsense. It seemed ok to me.
user:: I know. Last week he gave me a lie about being too busy.
chatbot:: Doesn't sound promising.
user:: Well, I think it's the time to pull the plug.
chatbot:: If you want I'll let him know if I run into him.
user:: Thanks anyway, but I'll do it, Rebecca. Let's get the class.
summary: Carole tells Rebecca about Simon's lie and Rebecca wants to help, but Carole decides to handle him herself.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Excuse me, sir?
user:: Yes?
chatbot:: I'm afraid you can't smoke here.
user:: Why not?
chatbot:: Can't you see the notes here?
user:: I'm sorry. I can't. What does the note say.
chatbot:: It says'No smoking'.
user:: Sorry, I'm very near sighted.
summary: chatbot: tells user: not to smoke here.

dialogue:
chatbot:: I'm so hungry. Shall we go eat now, Rick?
user:: sure. Where do you want to go? Are you in the mood for anything in particular?
chatbot:: how about some dumplings? I just can't get enough of them.
user:: dumplings again? ! Oh, Amy, let's try something new!
chatbot:: well, what do you have in mind?
user:: how about the Mongolian hot pot?
chatbot:: oh, it's too spicy for me. Don't you remember last time when I tasted the lamb? It was so spicy my eyes teared up!
user:: maybe we can try Yuanyang pot this time. You can choose the non-spicy soup base.
chatbot:: sounds great. Do they serve noodles? I am in the mood for some tasty noodles as well.
user:: yes. The sliced noodles they offer are among the most authentic Shanti cuisines.
chatbot:: great. Let's go!
user:: wait a minute. Let me throw on a sweater.
summary: Amy wants dumplings, but Rick wants a hot pot. They finally decide to try Yuanyang pot and have some noodles.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Mom! How can I help with the washing up?
user:: You peel the onions and wash them, then chop them.
chatbot:: OK! Then what can I do after I finish it?
user:: Let me see. Wash the cabbage over there.
chatbot:: OK, got it.
user:: What is your father doing now?
chatbot:: Reading newspaper on the couch.
user:: How about Daniel?
chatbot:: Staying with Ultraman, of course. You know he likes it very much.
user:: Be careful of the peeler. Don't cut your fingers.
chatbot:: I will.
user:: OK, we've finished. Can you get your father and brother?
chatbot:: OK!
summary: chatbot:'s helping Mom with the meal. Mom asks chatbot: what Dad and Daniel are doing.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Oh, Ralph, I heard it is very dangerous traveling in space. Disasters have happened before. If the spaceship were out of order. . .
user:: You should be optimistic about this. Things have taken a good turn. You should remember that less than two centuries ago the dangers of train travel seemed similarly terrible.
chatbot:: But is it possible that travelers could be hit by meteors?
user:: It's once in blue moon.
chatbot:: What do you think is the real danger man faced in space?
user:: The main one is radiation. There are two sorts of radiation man must fear in space. The first is radiation from the sun, and this is particularly dangerous when the sun is very active and explosions are occurring on its surface. The second, less harmful, comes from the so-called Van Allen Belts.
summary: Ralph is more optimistic than chatbot: about traveling in space. Ralph thinks the real danger is radiation and Van Allen Belts.

dialogue:
chatbot:: What do you think of this coffee table?
user:: It's nice, but it doesn't match the color of our room.
chatbot:: How about this one?
user:: Oh no, this type gets dirty very easily and it's difficult to clean.
chatbot:: Alright, let's look at some others.
user:: Look, this one matches our room and it's inexpensive.
chatbot:: Moreover, it's easy to clean, right? You are really lazy.
summary: chatbot: and user: are choosing a coffee table for their room.

dialogue:

chatbot:: Not from this brand, I'm afraid.
user:: What about other brands?

dialogue:
chatbot:: I was really glad to hear about your award, congratulations!
user:: Thanks. Actually, I was really surprised. I mean there were a lot of qualified people out there.
chatbot:: You'Ve been working there for so long with so much sacrifice. You definitely deserve it.
user:: Thanks a lot. I expect to see your name nominated pretty soon too. You'Ve been doing some great work.
