dialogue:
chatbot:: I haven't received my credit card bill yet.
user:: Which credit card are you speaking of?
chatbot:: My Master Card.
user:: We sent that bill out a couple of weeks ago.
chatbot:: I never got it.
user:: Your bill was mailed already.
chatbot:: What am I going to do since I haven't received the bill?
user:: If you haven't gotten it yet, then you should probably take that up with your post office.
chatbot:: Can I get an extension on my bill if it does happen to be the post office's fault?
user:: If that's the case, you will need to provide proof of their mistake.
chatbot:: Thanks for everything.
user:: Don't mention it. Call back if you have any more questions.
summary: chatbot: hasn't received credit card bills, and user: suggests chatbot: should take that up with chatbot:'s post office.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Excuse me. I want to pay the bill.
user:: Please wait till your name is called. OK. Your bill includes the doctor's fee and the cost for a 3 - day supply of medicine. It comes to one hundred yuan.
chatbot:: Here you are.
user:: Good. Here is the receipt. The dispensary is over there. . . By the way, will this be covered by your insurance from work?
chatbot:: No, I'll e paying for myself, but I have private medical insurance.
user:: In that case, I'll give you a certificate, so you can get it reimbursed.
chatbot:: Thanks a lot.
user:: Don't lose this receipt, because insurance companies are very difficult about helping when they don't have the right paperwork.
summary: chatbot: pays the bill with user:'s assistance. user: reminds chatbot: to keep the receipt for insurance.

dialogue:
chatbot:: I finally found an apartment that I want to rent.
user:: Where did you see it?
chatbot:: I saw it in this ad for apartments in today's newspaper.
user:: You found an apartment in the ads?
chatbot:: I really did, but what's so great about it is that it's really affordable.
user:: Tell me about the apartment.
chatbot:: Well, most importantly the apartment is beautiful.
user:: How much is the rent for the apartment?
chatbot:: The rent is $ 725 each month.
user:: That's pretty cheap for out here.
chatbot:: That's what I said when I found out how much the rent was.
user:: Congratulations on the new apartment.
summary: chatbot: tells user: chatbot: finds an beautiful and affordable apartment in the newspape

dialogue:
chatbot:: May I help you?
user:: Yes. I'd like to send this parcel to Changchun.
chatbot:: How do you want to send it?
user:: I guess I'll send it by airmail.
chatbot:: Is there anything valuable?
user:: No, there are only some vases.
chatbot:: They are fragile articles. They must be packed in a proper strong box. Your light cardboard box won't do.
user:: Have you got boxes for sale?
chatbot:: Yes.
user:: Is it all right this time?
chatbot:: Yes. Now fill in two customs declarations and one despatch note in English. You'll have to take your parcel to the next window for examination when you have completed the forms.
user:: OK.
chatbot:: Have you written down your return address?
user:: Yes, I have.
summary: user: plans to send the parcel of vases to Changchun by airmail. chatbot: suggests user: pack the fragile articles in a proper strong box.

dialogue:
chatbot:: What about the working hours?
user:: Working conditions are very relaxed. You may work whatever hours you want, provided you get your job done properly.
chatbot:: I like flexible hours.
user:: Would you mind changing the position or working place you've applied for?
chatbot:: No, I don't.
summary: chatbot: asks user: the working hours of the position.

dialogue:
chatbot:: An exhibition of Picasso's paintings is being held. Do you want to go with me?
user:: How can I miss it! But with the bus drivers on strike and taxis so expensive, we have no choice but to take the subway. If only we had a car.
summary: chatbot: invites user: to an exhibition. user:'ll take the subway there.

dialogue:
chatbot:: The day I turned thirty, I turned on the computer. I went into the over- thirty room for a joke. And he was there. And we started chatting.
user:: About what?
chatbot:: Books, music, how much we both love New York. Nothing really meaningful. Yet a good way to pass time.
user:: How come?
chatbot:: We don't talk about anything personal. We made a rule about that. I don't know his name, what he does, or exactly where he lives. So it will be really easy to stop seeing him, because I'm not.
summary: chatbot: tells user: chatbot: chatted with a man online but nothing personal when chatbot: turned thirty.

dialogue:
chatbot:: I understand how you feel, sir. But there simply isn't any room. The person who received your reservation call must have forgotten to write it down. I'm afraid it was just a mistake. She is new, you know.
user:: Just a mistake? Do you realize that I've invited some very important people to dinner? It could cause me to lose an important business partner.
chatbot:: I'm sorry, sir. I suggest you call them and explain the problem. I'm sure you'll find several other very good restaurants around here.
user:: I can't get in touch with them now. They are probably on their way at this very minute. Surely you could fit one more table in.
chatbot:: Not unless you'd like me to put you in the hall, sir.
user:: Well, that's better than nothing.
summary: chatbot: apologizes to user: for the reservation mistake. user: is angry but agrees to eat in the hall finally.

dialogue:
chatbot:: So, what seems to be the problem, Bobby?
user:: Dr. Cardano, I woke up in the middle of the night with a terrible pain in my right foot.
chatbot:: Did you cut yourself or knock it against something?
user:: No. It just started hurting all of a sudden.
chatbot:: Can you describe the pain for me? Is it a sharp pain that comes and goes? Or is it a constant, dull pain that doesn't really ever go away?
user:: I suppose it's more like the first one. But it's definitely difficult to walk, so it's not really going away, either.
chatbot:: Let me see those feet, Bobby.
user:: Do you want me to take off both socks?
chatbot:: Yes, I'd like to compare your right and left foot. Ah, the right foot is pretty red, and it looks bigger than the left one. It also feels warmer.
user:: What does it mean, doctor?
chatbot:: Well, I don't know for sure. It could be one of a couple of things. I'm going to send you up to the lab to get some blood tests. Check in to the lab on the third floor. I'm sending them some instructions. Come back down here as soon as it's finished.
user:: OK. I need to use the restroom first. Can you tell me where that is?
chatbot:: Go downstairs to the first floor. It's right next to the elevators.
user:: Thanks.
summary:
Bobby tells Dr. Cardano that he had a sharp pain in his right foot.
After seeing his right foot, Dr. Cardano decides to send him up to the lab on the third floor to get some blood tests.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Hi, Sally.
user:: Hello, Tom. How are you?
chatbot:: I'm fine. Where are you going?
user:: Oh, I'm on my way home from work.
chatbot:: I didn't know you had a job.
user:: Yeh. I work part-time at a supermarket.
chatbot:: What do you do there?
user:: I work in the produce section. Trimming and wrapping fresh fruit and vegetables. I also stock shelves. Sometimes when it really gets busy, work at the check-out counter. Have you got a job, Tom?
chatbot:: Yeh. I do yard work for people. You know, cutting grass, raking leaves. pulling weeds, things like that.
user:: I'd like doing that. It must be nice to work outdoors.
chatbot:: Sometimes it is. Except when it rains or snows or gets too hot or too cold or...
user:: Ha. Ha. I think every job has its shortcomings. There are times when get pretty tired of carrying things around at my job. But a job's a job Gotta earn money for school.
chatbot:: Me, too. Tuition is sure high, isn't it? Well, I'd better get going. I've got to plant some trees for my neighbours this afternoon.
user:: Well, don't work too hard. Holding down a job, going to class, studying. Sometimes it can become too much for one person. Take it easy.
chatbot:: You, too. It was great seeing you. Sally!
summary: Sally and Tom talk about their job. Sally works part-time in a supermarket, while Tom does yard work for people. They both agree that every job has its shortcomings but they need to work to earn money for school.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Susan, Did you know the four ugliest women in ancient China? 
user:: No, I only know four great beauties of China. 
chatbot:: There were some famous ugly women in history. 
user:: Yeah? Were they famous because of the ugliness? 
chatbot:: Though they were ugly, they had great virtue. 
user:: Then who were they? 
chatbot:: Mo Mu, Zhong Lichun, Meng Guang and Ruan Nv. They were well respected. 
user:: It seems that the inner beauty is also important. 
chatbot:: Sometimes the inner beauty is more beautiful.
summary: chatbot: introduced the four ugliest women who had great virtue in ancient China to Susan.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Argh. . . I feel terrible, I keep sneezing and my eyes are all watery, what's wrong with me? 
user:: Wow, you're not dying are you, it looks like you have a cold, you should take some medicine. 
chatbot:: I don't think it's a cold, I feel fine if I move a few feet away from my desk. 
user:: Maybe we should put you into quarantine, ha ha, jokes aside, I think you might have an allergy. 
chatbot:: An allergy? I never thought about that, I don't think I'm allergic to pollen though and I'm desensitized to bee stings after being stung so many times, Hmm. . . 
user:: Ow! Why did you chuck that peanut at me? 
chatbot:: Just checking if you're allergic to peanuts, I guess not. 
user:: Not funny! I could have gone into Anaphylactic Shock. 
chatbot:: Okay, my bad, how about dust? This office is full of it. 
user:: Yes the whole is office is dusty yet I only feel affected near our desks! 
#Person3#: Meow meow meow. 
chatbot:: You brought your cat into the office? ! 
user:: Yes, it's Mr. Snuffle's birthday today, I didn't want him to be alone on his special day! 
chatbot:: ACHOO! Argh, put it away, ACHOO! 
user:: I guess we found the problem, your allergic to cats!
summary: chatbot: feels terrible, and user: thinks chatbot: might get an allergy. user: tries to find out what triggers that, and it turns out that chatbot: is allergic to user:'s cat.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Ghost will be on at six thirty. It's already six fifteen now. Hurry up. 
user:: You'd been hanging around before left home. Well, now, you are urging me for the movie. This has been fun! 
chatbot:: Don't be upset. I am just afraid of missing the movie. It is your favorite. 
user:: In short, you become more and more impatient with me after wedding. 
chatbot:: Why do you think so?? 
user:: Every time I complain about the domestic chores with you, you just don't listen. 
chatbot:: Nothing of the sort! 
user:: Don't interrupt me! In addition, every time I need your advice, you just say, it's up to you. 
chatbot:: Maybe I was busy with my work at that time, so I felt a little bored. 
user:: You mean, I am not busy with my work? 
chatbot:: Honey, don't get me wrong. I don't know how to explain. But I really have eyes only for you and our children. 
user:: Do you still love me? 
chatbot:: Honey, maybe sometimes I seem careless, but I take great care to cooking breakfast every morning. That shows how much I love you. 
user:: Oh, honey, that's enough. Our love story is more touching than the Ghost. 
chatbot:: Let's go to see the movie. It's time to begin.
summary: user: thinks chatbot: is impatient and might not love user: anymore, but chatbot: reassures user: and they will watch the movie together.

dialogue:
chatbot:: I need a pan. 
user:: Okay. Do you have a particular size in mind? 
chatbot:: Well, the bigger the better, I think. 
user:: Look at this one. It's our biggest pan. 
chatbot:: Yes, that is big enough, but it's too heavy for me. 
user:: Okay, we have the same thing in aluminum. 
chatbot:: Oh, this is nice and light. But it has an aluminum handle. 
user:: Try this one. Same aluminum pan, but with a heat-resistant bamboo handle. 
chatbot:: Oh, yes. This is very nice. I'll take this one. 
user:: That's a good choice. How do you want to pay for it? 
chatbot:: Cash. Oh, I almost forgot. I need a lid, too. 
user:: I'm so sorry. A lid comes with the pan. Here it is.
summary: user: helps chatbot: to choose a big aluminum pan with a heat-resistant bamboo handle and a lid.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Lily, do you know Lizzy? 
user:: Lizzy who? 
chatbot:: Lizzy smith. 
user:: Of course I do. 
chatbot:: Then, Do you know her younger sister? 
user:: You mean Mary? 
chatbot:: Yes. 
user:: Sure. I know her elder sister Sue and younger sister Mary. 
chatbot:: Oh, not bad. Then do you know her mother? 
user:: Yes, certainly. I know her mother and father, and brother and sisters, too. 
chatbot:: That sounds terrific. 
user:: Why do you ask me these questions? 
chatbot:: I just want to visit the family some day.
summary: chatbot: asks Lily about Lizzy's family because chatbot: wants to pay a visit.

dialogue:
chatbot:: The Johnsons are on their way back. You remember them, don't you? 
user:: Johnson? I can't place them. 
chatbot:: We met them in Bermuda last May. 
user:: They've completely slipped my mind. 
chatbot:: The couple with the dogs-think back. 
user:: No, I don't recall a thing about them. 
chatbot:: Well, I've invited them for brunch. 
user:: Hmm, I must be getting absent-minded.
summary: chatbot: helps user: to recall the Johnsons but fails.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Hello. Capital Hotel. May I help you? 
user:: Yes, unlikely my flight will be 2 hours due to the fog. Would you please keep my reservation? 
chatbot:: Sure. May I have your name please? 
user:: Lincoln. That's L-I-N-C-O-L-N. Thank you.
summary: chatbot: helps Lincoln to keep the reservation.

dialogue:
chatbot:: May I take your order now, sir? 
user:: Yes, please. I'd like to start with a chef's salad. 
chatbot:: Chef's salad for starter. And what would you like to have for the main course? 
user:: I'll have steak. 
chatbot:: How would you like your steak done? 
user:: Medium. 
chatbot:: And what would you like to go with your steak? 
user:: Peas and carrots. 
chatbot:: Potatoes? 
user:: Boiled. 
chatbot:: Thank you.
summary: chatbot: helps user: order the starter and main course.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Would you hurry up? We're late.
user:: I know, I'm coming.
chatbot:: Our flight leaves in less than 2 hours. Come on.
user:: But I can't find my wallet.
chatbot:: If you hadn't overslept, we wouldn't be so stressed out right now.
user:: I'm sorry. I didn't hear my alarm. It's not like I did it on purpose. It's not my fault.
chatbot:: Well, it's definitely not my fault.
user:: Damn it. I can't find it. Do you see my wallet anywhere? It's made of brown leather.
chatbot:: Did you check your pockets?
user:: Of course I did. I'm not that dumb. Oh, wait a second. Oh, here it is.
chatbot:: Why am I not surprised? OK, put on your shoes and let's get out of here.
user:: Yeah, yeah. Say why don't we take the express train to the airport? It will be faster than a taxi.
chatbot:: Are you kidding me? A taxi will be way faster. We don't have time to argue about this. Let's just grab the first cab when we get downstairs.
user:: OK, OK.
chatbot:: What is it now?
user:: I can't find my keys.
summary: chatbot: asks user: to hurry up, but user: can't find the wallet. chatbot: complains but user: doesn't think it's user:'s fault. When they are about to take the taxi, user: can't find the keys.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Have you been watching the Euro 2012 football tournament?
user:: Just a bit. Have you?
chatbot:: Of course. I really started to like football since I came to London. Just think a year ago I was still in Montreal and didn't know a thing about it.
user:: Well, I'm from New Jersey. Americans aren't so into football, either. Actually we call it soccer. When Americans say football, what we mean is American rules football. I've been here 2 years now, and I still get confused when people call soccer football.
chatbot:: Oh, that's right. For you Americans football means the sport where those big guys wear helmets and violently run into each other.
user:: Yeah, Americans prefer watching sports that are fast like basketball. I think basketball players are some of the greatest athletes on earth. What they can do just amazes me. But when I watch a soccer match, I just get board. There aren't enough goals.
chatbot:: Well, I see what you're saying. But there's so much more to soccer as you call it than goals. There are a lot of strategies involved. And in a tournament like Euro 2012, it's fascinating to see how the different countries have different styles of playing.
summary: chatbot: and user: talk about the differences between American football and soccer. user: thinks soccer is boring, but chatbot: disagrees.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Is that the Park Hotel? Reservation desk, please.
user:: Reservation desk. May I help you?
chatbot:: Yes, please. I'm phoning from the airport here in Los Angeles. I'd like to reserve a single room for tonight.
user:: Alright, sir. That's a single room with a bath?
chatbot:: That's right. How much will that be?
user:: Our singles began at 45 per night, sir.
chatbot:: Good. In that case, I'll take a room, please.
user:: Your name, please.
chatbot:: My name is Tony Chan. T-O-N-Y.
user:: Thank you, Mr. Chan. When will you be arriving?
chatbot:: I'm arriving very soon. I'm waiting for a taxi to the hotel.
user:: Right, sir. We'll hold your room for you until 9:00 PM.
summary: Tony calls user: from the airport to reserve a single room. user: tells him the price and will hold the room until 9:00 PM.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Hello is that Phil Taylor?
user:: Speaking.
chatbot:: Hi Phil. I'm a Reporter for the Sun. I'm calling to ask you a few questions about the fire. Can you tell me how it happened?
user:: Sure. Well it was 2 days ago on November the tenth about 11:00 PM. I decided to fry some chips so I used quite a lot of oil. I was deep frying. Uhm the oil finally got hot enough, so I put the chips in and then my mom rang.
chatbot:: Ah.
user:: We started talking and I completely forgot about the chips. After the call. I just went back to my living room.
chatbot:: Oh no.
user:: Yes, I watch TV for about 20 minutes and the next thing I knew there was the smell of smoke in someone was shouting fire fire. I immediately realized it was my chips. I rushed out of the room. The kitchen was next door. Well, there were flames all over one wall.
chatbot:: What did you do?
user:: Well, I grabbed some blankets from my bed and ran to the kitchen to throw them over the flames. By that time, my neighbors had already called the fire Department. The firefighters arrived, I think within about 10 minutes and put the fire out very quickly.
chatbot:: So what was the damage.
user:: Well. I'll have to replace the cooker completely. Besides, I have to have 2 kitchen units and one wall repaired.
summary: chatbot: asks Phil Taylor about the fire. Taylor says that he forgot the chips in the pan, which caused the fire. Then he took action fast and the Fire Department put out the fire.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Good morning. You have reached the Monterrey Bay in.
user:: Good morning, sir. I'm calling to cancel a reservation.
chatbot:: Alright. What are the dates for that reservation?
user:: They are January twenty nineth through February 1.
chatbot:: OK. Would you like to book a room for another day? We are having a special deal in March if you book a room for 2 days. You get the third day for free.
user:: No, sir. I've started a new job recently so I won't have anytime off for at least 6 months.
chatbot:: I see. Well, I do hope you consider our hotel when you get some vacation time so that will be $280 returned to you. Would you like me to put it back on your visa?
user:: Yes, thank you, sir.
summary: user: tells chatbot: that user: has found a new job and wants to cancel the hotel reservation. chatbot: will return the money.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Thanks for coming in today. Please have a seat. Tell me a little bit about yourself. Why do you think you are qualified for this job?
user:: I've worked as a music teacher my whole life, mainly with children. And now I'm ready for a change, because I love music so much. I think working at a radio station would be perfect for me.
chatbot:: The duties of this job include answering the phones and sending emails. How are you with both of those things?
user:: I'm experienced in sending emails and I'm also fairly confident on the phone. When I was a teenager, I worked at a TV station answering phone calls. So this is probably pretty similar.
chatbot:: We also have some early mornings here in the studio. Sometimes you'll have to be here around 4:00 or 5:00 AM? How do you feel about that?
user:: I'm an early riser, so that's easy for me. It also means less traffic, which I'm always a fan of.
chatbot:: Do you have references I can call?
user:: Yes, I have a list to give you. Two are people I worked with at my last job, and one is an old graduate school professor of mine.
chatbot:: Great! Well, I think that's it. I'll give you a call back in the next few days to let you know our decision.
user:: Thank you so much.
summary: user: applies for a job at a radio station. chatbot: interviews user: about user:'s working experience, abilities, and references. After user: answering these questions, chatbot: tells user: to wait for the result.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Oh, what a beautiful cat! What do you think?
user:: I think I'd rather get a dog. Dogs are more faithful than cats.
chatbot:: Yes, but there so much work. Would you be willing to walk it every single day and clean up after it?
user:: We'd have to invest a lot of money in a cage or a fish tank, and I don't really know how to take care of a bird or a fish.

dialogue:

chatbot:: What do you like best about your job?

dialogue:

dialogue:

chatbot:: Correct! Another contrast is the rules for the general and the king. It seems the general or marshal in xiangqi is much too incompetent. They are required to stay in the palace, waiting to be checked and fleeing for life under the cover of the guards. Look at the king in chess, he is much more capable.
user:: Yeah, and though the king in chess doesn't have bodyguards, he has a queen who is the most powerful piece. I think this demonstrates the relatively higher social status of aristocratic women in medieval Europe than in China.
chatbot:: There's another distinctive contrast. Both board games use a total of 32 pieces, but xiangqi is played on a 9 - by - 9 board, bigger than the 8 - by - 8 board used in chess.
user:: You mean, xiangqi pieces are allowed a larger space in which to move around?
chatbot:: Sure. On a chessboard, fire is much more intensive. It has a smaller board, while those bigger pieces-chariots, horses and bishops-can cover longer distances.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Dear audiences, today we'll talk about divorce and its effect on children. Our guest is Jennifer Benzes. Thank you for coming, Jennifer. Do you mind saying something about your divorce?
user:: No. I got divorced years ago. Even worse, I got divorced when I had small children.
chatbot:: Have you thought of the effect divorce may have on your children? Their needs can be forgotten as parents are struggling to re-establish their lives.
user:: Of course, we have. We are definitely more aware of the impact on children. After all we are not famous people who trade spouses like shoes. For most of us divorce is not entered into lightly. We all suffer. Anyway, we try to comfort our children.
chatbot:: How?
user:: We tell them we love them and will always do.
chatbot:: You haven't thought of saving the marriage?
user:: Yes, we have. We would do anything to spare our children pain. But you know, fixing a marriage is not like changing a tire. Family conflicts may take hold like a cancer.
chatbot:: Then divorce is the only way to get rid of it.
user:: It's true with me. Others may succeed in fixing.
chatbot:: Yet most people believe a hard marriage is better for children than a divorce. According to a recent poll, more people today think parents should stay together for the sake of the children What do you think?
user:: I think the cost of staying together is worse than the benefits. Parents quarreling and fighting all day may do more harm to their children.
chatbot:: What do you want society to do for you?
user:: Understand us, not curse us. More importantly, they should help us share the loss and build a better future.
summary: Jennifer Benzes is sharing her divorce and its impact on her children with the audience. She thinks fixing a marriage isn't better for children though most people think the opposite and she wants society to understand them instead of cursing them.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Thanks for coming in today, did you have any trouble finding us? Please take a seat.
user:: Thank you.
chatbot:: So, let's get started. tell me a bit about your educational background.
user:: Sure! Well, I graduated with honors from Chesterton University with a major in Business Administration, with a specialization in Information Management, and I minored in psychology. I chose this course of study for two reasons. I wanted to gain some practical, marketable skills, which the information management track provided, and I also feel that interpersonal skills are essential for professional success, hence the minor in psychology.
chatbot:: Interesting. And, your postgraduate studies?
user:: Well, I am really passionate about consumer behavior, so I pursued a master's in that area. I also strive to keep my professional skills current, so I continuously attend seminars and conferences related management and customer service.
chatbot:: Very good. Now, tell me a little bit about your work experience. I see here that you previously worked at Oracle.
user:: Yeah, I worked as their customer support manager, which brought me a breadth of experience in both client care, and process management. I supervised and coordinated the customer support team as well as implemented new strategies to achieve better customer satisfaction.
chatbot:: Interesting. . .
user:: Yes, in this position I was able to make some pretty significant contributions to the overall success of the company. With the different initiatives that we implemented, we lowered our churn rate to about five percent, which had a direct impact on revenue.
summary: chatbot: interviews user:. user: introduces the educational background of undergraduate and postgraduate studies and previous work experience at Oracle to chatbot:. user: also tells chatbot: user: can make significant contributions to the overall success of the company.

dialogue:
chatbot:: I don't understand why you always look so happy, so energetic. It seems like you'Ve got good news everyday.
user:: Really? Do I look happy all the time?
chatbot:: All I know is you look quite differently from other teachers.
user:: Oh, do you know why? Actually, it's easy. Because I always exercise. My exercise, I think, is very hard. I often feel very good after conquering these difficulties. I feel alive!
chatbot:: Oh, I know. I saw you doing pull-ups one time on the campus 5 and some students trying to imitate you.
user:: Yeah, they are doing it for fun. Seldom would people like my exercise. It's difficult and boring.
chatbot:: It's true. Many students do the exercise when they have to. We have P. E. once a week.
user:: But I think Chinese students need to exercise more. Besides exercise will help them learn new things better. Don't students want to have a good memory?
chatbot:: Of course. I didn't know that. I only know exercise makes bodies stronger. I should take some exercise then. Do you have any suggestions?
user:: Well, do what you like to do. It can be anything. Jogging, doing aerobics, going bicycling, and playing ping-pong. Absolutely anything. Doing three or more workouts a week is good for you. But remember to do some stretches first.
chatbot:: Oh, I know. Thank you.
summary: chatbot: thinks user: is different from other teachers as user: always looks happy and energetic. user: shares with chatbot: that doing exercise helps people keep a good memory and make people stronger.

dialogue:

dialogue:

dialogue:
chatbot:: Hey. Can you give me a hand with the groceries? And I told you I could do the shopping.
user:: Wow! Do we really need all this stuff? Let me see that receipt.
chatbot:: Hey, I only bought the essentials.
user:: Okay. Let's see. Dog food. Twenty-four dollars and seventy cents ($24.70)? We don't even have a dog!
chatbot:: Well, it WAS going to be a surprise, but look in the back of the truck.
user:: What?
chatbot:: Ah, ha, hah. Speechless. I knew you'd love him.
user:: That thing? That dog's as big as a horse. He probably eats like one, too.
chatbot:: Ah, but he's sure friendly. And someone was giving him away at the supermarket, and I... I... I couldn't let that poor thing pass another day without a loving home.
user:: Whatever. Where was I? Eighteen dollars and nineteen cents ($18.19) for twenty-four cans of tomato juice? You don't even like that stuff!
chatbot:: Ahhhh. Not yet. I've decided to change my eating habits.
user:: Right.
chatbot:: You'll see, you'll see.
user:: Okay. Let's see. Three eighty-four ($3.84) for a box of chocolate cookies and twelve fifty-six ($12.56) for a case of soft drinks.
chatbot:: Yeah!
user:: Changing your eating habits, huh? Do you really think that cookies are some type of diet food?
chatbot:: Hey, I'll just eat a cookie or two every other hour. In fact, they're a great source of carbohydrates for energy. And, you see, the tomato juice and cookies kind of, you know, cancel each other out.
user:: Oh brother. I can't believe what I'm hearing. Let's see. Where was I? A carton of eggs, two fifty ($2.50) for a gallon of milk, three cans of tuna. Okay. [Yeah.] And finally two steaks for eight fourteen ($8.14). Now, something worth enjoying. I'll get the grill started.
chatbot:: Oh, we... w... well. The steaks are for Herbert.
user:: Herbert. Who's Herbert?
chatbot:: Uh, he's the dog.
user:: No!
chatbot:: You see, the previous owner said that he's kind of... he's somewhat picky about what he eats.
user:: No!
chatbot:: And the steaks might help him adjust.
user:: Absolutely not!
chatbot:: No, no, no, and the steaks might help him adjust to his new home. Hey, what are you doing? Oh, no. Why did you throw the steaks out on the ground outside?
user:: Well, now, you and Herbert can get to know each other better. I'm going out to eat by myself.
chatbot:: Ughh.
summary: user: looks at chatbot:'s shopping receipt and is angry that there are so many things for a dog but few things for user:. chatbot: wants to take a dog called Herbert home. And user: is angrier when user: finds the steaks are for Herbet but not user:.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Hi! Is that the new laptop you brought last week? It looks very nice. 
user:: Yes, it is. Thanks. I'm just surfing on the internet. 
chatbot:: Here? In this cafe? How can you do that? 
user:: This cafe offers a wireless internet connection. That means I can get on the net for free while I'm here. Of course , I have to buy a cup of coffee! 
chatbot:: That's great. Can you do it anywhere? 
user:: No. you can only do it when the cafe offers a wireless connection. There are only about 10 or 12 places that offer it in this city. 
chatbot:: So, what programes do you have on your laptop? 
user:: I've got all the usual ones for word processing and then I have a few for creating and editing photographs. 
chatbot:: I know you are keen on photography. It's very useful for you to be able to download photos from your digital camera. Then you attach the picture files to emails and send them to anyone, anywhere, at anytime! 
user:: It's wonderful, isn't it? Would you like to see some photos that I look recently?

dialogue:
chatbot:: Are there any interesting stories in the newspaper today? 
user:: There are a few stories about natural disasters. There is a massive forest fire in Australia. It covers several square kilometers of land has destroyed many more square kilometers. 
chatbot:: Was it caused accidentally or naturally? Sometimes it gets so hot that fires begin naturally in Australia and Africa. 
user:: Nobody knows at the moment, but it has been very hot there recently. The drought in Africa is causing starvation. Millions of people have migrated to try and find food. 
chatbot:: What is the international community doing to help? 
user:: The European union has sent several plants with relief supplies. Several countries have sent soldiers to distribute food and medical supplies. Refugee camps have been set up across the region. 
chatbot:: How many countries have been affected? 
user:: Six have been seriously affected, but the refugees are also migrating to several surrounding countries. 
chatbot:: I saw on the tv yesterday that there has been another earthquake in Iran. 
user:: Yes. There have been a few there recently. They say that this one was not a big quake. The Iranians are dealing with it on their own. They have purchased some special equipment to find people buried under rubble. 
chatbot:: Does the newspaper say anything about casualties? 
user:: So far, less than 20 people have died, but over 100 are in hospital.
summary: user: tells chatbot: the news of natural disasters reported in today's newspaper, including the massive forest fire in Australia, the starvation in Africa, an earthquake in Iran, and the help of the international community in Australia and Africa.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Ah, that's the forth ad that appears suddenly on my computer screen since I started working on my paper.
user:: You can buy an app that will stop those ads.

user:: It's not that expensive. It's $1 per month.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Thank you. The tea smells good. What is it called?
user:: It's called Tie Guanyin, and is a kind of Wulong tea.
chatbot:: I've heard this name before, but I could never understand the tea classification.
user:: It's confusing and there is no agreement on it. Generally speaking, there are 4 kinds of tea based on processing methods. They're green tea, black tea, Wulong tea and scented tea.
chatbot:: It is said that different kinds of tea have different health benefits, isn't it?
user:: Yes, it is. But there are also considerations of time and personal health. For example, green tea is good in summer. It seems to drive away the heat and bring a feeling of relaxation. However, pregnant women should not drink it.
chatbot:: There seems to be a lot to know about tea. You must tell me more about tea culture in the future.
user:: Sure, I'll be glad to.
summary: user: shares knowledge of different teas with chatbot:, including the classification based on processing methods and their health benefits.

user:: Sure, we will. Rush hour is almost over. Anyway, the party starts at 30 minutes later, but I do need help with directions. Can you call the restaurant and ask them where we park our car?

dialogue:
chatbot:: I saw a beautiful fish in the market the other day, it was orange and blue. I'm thinking of buying some next Sunday.
user:: Where would you keep them?
chatbot:: In that round bottle over there.
user:: It's a bit small, isn't it?
chatbot:: So are the fish.
user:: I think you should get a tank if you want to keep fish.
chatbot:: Really?
user:: Yes, you should never keep fish in a small round bottle. They don't get enough air. I suggest we go shopping together and look for a nice tank.
chatbot:: That might be quite expensive.
user:: Check the prices before you buy one and you ought to put a few large rocks in the tank. Fish love swimming around the rocks and through holes in them.
chatbot:: Is there anything else that I ought to get?
user:: Yes, you need to get some underwater plants, for one thing they keep the water clean, also they make the tank look much prettier.
summary: user: tells chatbot: things that should be prepared for keeping fish, including a tank, some rocks, and underwater plants.

dialogue:

dialogue:
chatbot:: Trina, will you marry me?
user:: Yes! Yes! And yes! Jared, of course I'll marry you!
chatbot:: Oh, Babe, I can't wait to spend the rest of my life with you! I can't wait for all the adventures we're going to have, for all the fights and the laughter. I can't wait to grow old and wrinkly with you.
user:: Oh, Jared! I can't wait for our wedding! I hope you don't mind, but I'Ve already chosen a date! Six months from now in the summer! Melissa saw you buying the ring last month so I'Ve had plenty of time to start planning!
chatbot:: She what?
user:: Oh don't worry, sweetie, I didn't know when you were going to propose. It was still a nice surprise! As I was saying, I'Ve got it all planned out. There's almost nothing left to do! I wrote up our guest list and we will have roughly four hundred guests attending.
chatbot:: Four hundred?
user:: No need to sweat it. My parents agreed to pay for most of the wedding, which is going to be low-budget anyway. So roughly four hundred people, which means that the hall at Northwoods Heights will be our reception venue. I thought it would be nice if we had the wedding at your parents'church and my uncle of course would be officiating. We'll meet with him soon for some pre-wedding counseling. The music for the wedding ceremony was a no-brainer. My step-sister and her string quartet will take care of that. My cousin will be the official photographer. I thought it would also be nice if his daughter could sing a solo. Did you know that she's going to be a professional opera singer?
chatbot:: Ah. . .
user:: And then of course the ladies at the church would love to be our caterers for the banquet and we'll get the Youth Group to serve us. I was thinking that your friend's band could be our entertainment for the night. though they might have to tone it down a bit. Or we could hire a DJ. Your sister's husband could get us a discount with that company that does the decor at weddings. what's their name again? I was thinking that we could have an island paradise-themed wedding and our theme color would be a soothing blue like Aquamarine. And there will be a huge seashell on the wall behind the podium where we'll make our toasts! What do you think of small packages of drink mixes for our wedding favors? Who else am I missing? Oh, your uncle could be our florist and his wife could make our wedding cake!
chatbot:: Wow.
user:: See? It's going to be wonderful! Oh this wedding is going to be everything I ever dreamed of.
chatbot:: If I survive the next six months.
summary: Trina accepts Jared's proposal. Then, Jared is astonished to know that Trina already knew from Melissa who saw him buying the ring that he was planning this. Trina has chosen a date and has made a list of four hundred guests and she tells Jared about her arrangements in an ecstasy. Jared finds it hard to get through.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Are you alright, Ethan? You don't seem to be as cheerful as you normally are.
user:: To be honest, Ava, I've just had a really bad day.
chatbot:: What happened?
user:: First, I slept through my alarm and ended up two hours late to work.
chatbot:: What did your boss say?
user:: He told me that if I showed up late one more time, he'd fire me. He's so mean!
chatbot:: That's horrible. Was that the first time you'd shown up late to work?
user:: That was my second time. The first time, I was in a car accident.
chatbot:: Is your boss Chinese?
user:: No, he's from Australia. Before I met him, I thought Australians were supposed to be relaxed and easy-going. I had no idea he'd be so fussy about things.
chatbot:: What are you going to do?
user:: I think I'm going to look for another job. I need to find a boss that is a bit more sensitive and optimistic than my current boss.
chatbot:: That sounds like a sensible plan. Do you want me to help you with your job search?
user:: That's very generous of you. Thanks for the offer.
chatbot:: Don't mention it. That's what friends are for!
summary: Ethan is not cheerful because his boss threats to fire him if he shows up late one more time. Ethan will look for another job with a more sensitive and optimistic boss. Ava offers to help him with it.

dialogue:
chatbot:: So, Monica, what do you feel like doing this afternoon?
user:: Actually, I had a perfect plan for this afternoon, but it is totally ruined by the sand storm. I woke up this morning and found it was sunny. So I called Lucy and asked her to go shopping with me. We were going to look for a new purse. Now it turned out to be like this. Neither of us wants to go to outside anymore.
chatbot:: That's too bad. I hate sand storms too. It can be worse than any kind of bad weather.
user:: What's wrong with climate? Anyway, I think the sand storm happens more frequently these days than the years before. Can't people do something to stop it?
chatbot:: It is not an easy job. The government is working on it. Lots of trees have been planted in the north of the capital. Also, methods of generating rain are being used by the government to fight against the drought. But of course, it will not work overnight. So, have you come out with a new plan for today?
user:: My new plan is to wait for the end of the sand storm and clean my apartment.
summary: Monica had to give up her shopping plan with Lucy because of the sand storm. chatbot: tells her the government is working to try to stop the sand storm by planting trees.

dialogue:

chatbot:: And how long have you been feeling like this?
user:: Three days now.
chatbot:: Let me have a look. Open your mouth please. Wider please. Now say AHH.
user:: AHHH.
chatbot:: Now take your shirt off please. Breathe in-Breathe out-OK, you can put your shirt back on now.

chatbot:: Oh, no. Don't be so nervous. You just have a bad cold. Do you work in an air-conditioned office?
user:: Yes, I do.
chatbot:: I thought so. I see many people who work in air-conditioned offices. It's the air conditioning, you see. It's really not very good for your health.
user:: So what would you suggest, doctor?
chatbot:: I suggest you get out of the office as regularly as possible. Walk around, and get some fresh air. That will help. You also need to get more exercise. Do you play any sports?
user:: I sometimes play tennis in summer, but to be honest, I'm too busy to get regular exercise.
chatbot:: Then I suggest you try playing more often. Say once a week.
user:: OK, no problem. Thank you doctor. Bye.
chatbot:: Bye.
summary: Mrs. Brown gives user: a physical check and diagnoses that user: has a bad cold. Mrs. Brown suggests user: get out of the air-conditioned offices as regularly as possible and do more exercise.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Excuse me. I need to refill this prescription.
user:: It says on the bottle here that you can have two refills.
chatbot:: Yes, I need to refill it today.
user:: Alright. I'm sorry, Miss. According to our file, this prescription has already been refilled twice.
chatbot:: I was worried about that. I couldn't remember if I had it refilled twice yet or not.
user:: Well, it looks like you have.You will need to see your doctor to get a new prescription.
chatbot:: Listen. This is an emergency. I tried to call my doctor, but he is out of town. So I can't see him in time. I need this medicine. It is for skin condition. I've run out.Can you just refill it once more?
user:: I'm sorry, Miss. We can't do it. We must follow the prescription.And this prescription has run out.
chatbot:: But I need it. Please. Refill it for me just this once. I can go to the doctor around ten days from now. Then I'll have another prescription.
user:: Miss, I understand your problem.But it is against the law for us to sell certain medicines without a prescription.It ' s the law. I can't do anything about it.We never sell medicine unless we have a proper prescription. Never.
chatbot:: But I have a prescription. I just need more of it.
user:: A prescription must be valid. It cannot be an expired prescription. I'm sorry, Miss. It's the law.You will have to find another doctor who will prescribe this for you.
chatbot:: Oh, it will be so expensive! I have a special medical plan, and I can only see one doctor.It will cost me a lot of money to see another doctor.
user:: Miss, I just can't help you on this. I'm a pharmacist, not a doctor. And there are other customers I need to help now. I know it is frustrating when this happens.But there is nothing I can do about it. I'm sorry.
chatbot:: This is ridiculous! In Taiwan, it is much easier to get medicine when I need it.
user:: Maybe that's true. I don't know.But I'm sure in Taiwan you have prescriptions too.
summary: chatbot: asks user: to refill a prescription but user: refuses her because it has been refilled twice. chatbot: insists as it's an emergency. user: says it's illegal to sell medicine without a valid prescription and suggests chatbot: see another doctor. user: says it's expensive to see a new doctor and thinks it is ridiculous as it's much easier to get medicine in Taiwan.

dialogue:
chatbot:: I think that show biz stars have a really easy life. They have lots of money, so they can buy almost anything they want. They're famous, so everyone loves them.

user:: I think that few of the show biz stars want any publicity for themselves. They only want it for their films.
chatbot:: No way! They want publicity for themselves, so that they get invited to make more films, go to lots of cocktail parties, and even make albums! They have such an easy life. They don't even pay for drinks when they go to a cocktail party.
user:: Show biz stars have plenty of expenses. That's why they need so much money. They need million of dollars to buy big, seclude houses and wonderful dresses. I bet most show biz stars would prefer to wear jeans and a t-shirt, but they can't because their managers force them to wear clothes they don't like.
chatbot:: I don't understand how you can have any sympathy for show biz stars. They're overpaid, over-ambitious, and over-adored.
user:: I think you should give them some credit. They're very talented people and they deserve all the money they earn. They even donate money to charity to help people who are less fortunate than themselves.
chatbot:: Come on! They only do that to get even more publicity for their films and themselves.
summary: chatbot: and user: hold different views on show biz stars. chatbot: thinks they have an easy life, they love publicity to get them more films and social activities, they are overpaid, over-ambitious, and over-adored. But user: shows sympathy to show biz stars and thinks chatbot: should give them some credit.

dialogue:

chatbot:: It's not all techno music. It's not a special techno night.
user:: No. But they play techno all the time. It drives me crazy after forty minutes. And anyhow, if we go to the Latin Club you could actually learn some Latin dance steps. At the New Bar you'll just shake yourself around for an hour. And then you'll get sick of stand you'll want to go get drunk somewhere where the drinks are cheaper. I know you.
chatbot:: It's fine with me if we go to the Latin Club. I like Latin Music. The only thing I never want to do again is listen to country rock. What was that bar called?

chatbot:: No. It was that friend of yours, Melissa. Her and all her lousy country music Cds. Yecch!

user:: Well, it seems you'll have to learn some Spanish too, won't you?
chatbot:: Maybe.
summary: chatbot: and user: discuss where to go on Friday night. chatbot: likes to dance and go to new bars but user: wants to go to the Latin Club. They both hate Melissa's country rock and agree to go to the Latin Club. chatbot: wants to user: teaches chatbot: the samba, tango, and Spanish.

dialogue:

user:: It's wise to do it. The Americans have the habit of selling their junk when they are moving to another place, so they usually display all the things they want to sell in their gardens at the weekend. And many things they are selling still look quite new and they are also very useful.
chatbot:: I have heard about it while in China. it is called a ' yard sale '. I didn't have any idea of that until today when I came here to the big ' yard sale '.
user:: You must have got many useful things for your new apartment.

dialogue:
chatbot:: Hi dude, you look upset, what's up?

chatbot:: What's the problem?
user:: Every night my roommates watch the Korean soap operas till mid-night. I am not a big fan of Korean shows and I don't know how to tell them to stop without hurting their feelings.
chatbot:: Well, you can simply tell them you want to sleep, or make an agreement for a time when the room should quiet down.
user:: Yeah, I know, but I find these sorts of things hard to say. They won't like it if I tell them to turn off the TV. Now I just hope the show will end soon.
chatbot:: I understand. I used to live in a dorm with four people. I was great in some aspects. We always went out and and had fun together. But on the other hand, when I wanted some quiet time, and people kept talking and laughing aloud, it was torturous. For me a room to myself, even a small one, is ideal. Though I don't mind sharing an apartment with somebody.
user:: Yeah, I crave my own space. I just get so tiredhaving people around me all the time. We all need our private space. But I also think interpersonal skills very important. Living in a dorm means you have to learn to be considerate of others, otherwise nobody is going to have a good time.
summary: user: is disturbed by roommates late at night and doesn't know how to stop them euphemistically. chatbot: advises user: to tell them about it or make an agreement for keeping quiet. They both think having private rooms and sharing rooms have different advantages.

dialogue:

Then out of nowhere she called me up, said her boyfriend had made plans and that she need to cancel the trip. I was so angry when she told me that I said she didn't care about our friendship at all.

The Scotsman brought a map. 'If we get lost, we'll be able to find our way. ' The Irishman had brought a car door.

dialogue:
